comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Douglas_%28British_Army_off... "General Sir Charles Whittingham Horsley Douglas, GCB, ADC (17 July 1850 – 25 October 1914), was a British officer serving as Chief of the Imperial General Staff (CIGS) during the first months of World War I." He was appointed to that post on April 6. 1914.
